org.chronos.chronodb.internal.impl.jdbc.util

Class JdbcUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.chronos.chronodb.internal.impl.jdbc.util.JdbcUtils

  • public class JdbcUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains commonly used JDBC methods.

    This class is thread-safe. All methods work exclusively on the provided objects.

    • Method Detail

      • dropTableIfExists

        public static boolean dropTableIfExists(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                        java.lang.String tableName)
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Drops the table with the given name in the database, if it exists.

        If the table does not exist in the database, this method does nothing.

        Parameters:
        connection - The connection to use. Must not be null. Must not be closed.
        tableName - The name of the table to drop. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        true if the table was dropped successfully, or false if it did not exist.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if a database error occurs during the operation.

      • tableExists

        public static boolean tableExists(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                  java.lang.String tableName)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks if a table with the given name exists in the database.
        Parameters:
        connection - The connection to use. Must not be null. Must not be closed.
        tableName - The name of the table to search for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        true if the database contains a table with the given name, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if a database error occurs during the operation.

      • getTableNames

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTableNames(java.sql.Connection connection)
                                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns the names of all tables in the given database.
        Parameters:
        connection - The connection to use. Must not be null. Must not be closed.
        Returns:
        The list of table names in the given database. May be empty, but never null.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if a database error occurs during the operation.

        public static java.lang.String renderCreateTableStatement(java.lang.String tableName,

                                                          java.lang.String pkType,
                                                          java.lang.String... columnsAndTypes)

      • resolvePreparedStatement

        public static java.lang.String resolvePreparedStatement(java.lang.String preparedStatement,
                                                        java.lang.Object... args)
        Resolves the given prepared statement by replacing the placeholders with the given arguments.

        WARNING:
        This method is intended primarily for debugging purposes and does not perform any kind of sanity checking. It is strongly discouraged to execute the result of this operation on an SQL server!

        Parameters:
        preparedStatement - The prepared statement to resolve into a full statement. Must not be null.
        args - The arguments to use as replacement for the placeholders in the prepared statement. The number of arguments must be equal to the number of placeholders in the prepared statement.
        Returns:
        The resolved SQL statement as a string. Never null.

      • isConnectionOpen

        public static boolean isConnectionOpen(java.sql.Connection connection)
